https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/551.name: *Virtual Drop-Ins with Career Peer Mentors (9-10pm Sun-Thurs)
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/551.description:
Scheduled for 9:00pm - 10:00pm EST Sundays, Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays

SESSION LINK: https://cmu.zoom.us/s/3719501566

No need to schedule an appointment or register!

These virtual sessions with a Career Peer Mentor will occur one hour every day (Sun-Thurs). Open to all undergrads in all colleges, this is a quick, easy way to ask whatever career-related topic is on your mind. Advanced registration is not required, however, please be patient in the Zoom waiting room as other students may be ahead of you in the queue.

Drop-Ins should be used to get answers to short, last-minute questions, or for quick reviews that need an immediate response. They should not be used for in-depth conversations or thorough resume reviews—those appointments should be scheduled with your College Consultant in Handshake.

SESSION LINK: https://cmu.zoom.us/s/3719501566

Sundays 9:00pm - Staffed by Evelyn Shi (Junior - StatML)
                                                     & Drishika Dugar (Senior - CivE)

Mondays 9:00pm - Staffed by Patricia Yu  (Junior - Design & HCI)
                                                      & Rahul Joglekar  (Junior - ChemE & BME)

Tuesdays 9:00pm - Staffed by Juliette Wong  (Senior - Math Operations Research & Stats)
                                                        & Vinay Gonugondla  (Senior - Business Finance & Stats)

Wednesdays 9:00pm - Staffed by Adriana Martinez (Senior - ECE)
                                                          & Aashav Mehta (Junior -Business Finance and Business Analytics)

Thursdays 9:00pm - Staffed by Kelly Yang (Junior - Business Administration)
                                                        & Karina Chiu (Senior - Business Marketing)View full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.name: Data Science Internship Information Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description: Are you a STEM Master's or PhD student and interested in a summer Data Science internship? If so, Capital One invites you to an interactive information session and associate panel where you'll learn about #LifeAtCapitalOne, our Data Science community, and how Data Science supports our customers everyday. You'll also hear from a recruiter about the internship experience and how to apply. We look forward to seeing you!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/588.name: Keyence Networking Event For Business Students
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/588.description: Network with Keyence`s Talent team and other students from universities all across the USA!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/592.name: Real People, Real Talk at Reynolds: Amy Harp
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/592.description: Please join us as our VP of Digital Marketing and E-Commerce, Amy Harp, talks about how we are using cutting edge marketing techniques to disrupt the market and move our business forward!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.name: Career Panel: A New Reality for Industrial Design
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.description:
Step into the rapidly-expanding world of extended reality (XR) with IDSA Boston and XR Terra for an in-depth discussion about the opportunities this growing industry offers for industrial designers.
According to Burning Glass’s 2019 report on real-time 3D skills, the demand for ID, UI, and UX skills far exceeds supply. Companies are investing heavily in XR technologies to enhance how people experience products and services. As these industries transform, there is a greater need for industrial design expertise to help shape them.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.name: Coding Practice with Kick Start: Problem Walkthroughs and Solutions
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.description:
Problem Walkthroughs and Solutions

Looking to brush up on your coding skills? Want to try something new? Then join us for Coding Practice with Kick Start! Work your way through five algorithmic and mathematical problems on the Kick Start platform in a week-long practice session from October 28 - November 4. This practice session is not an official Kick Start round but a great way for you to engage with the Kick Start platform, connect with your peers, prepare for an interview, and most importantly have fun!

Be sure to RSVP for the event and tune into our first livestream to kick-off Coding Practice with Kick Start on Wednesday, October 28 at 4:30 p.m. PT / 7:30 p.m. ET. At the close of the week-long practices session, tune back in again on November 4 at 4:30 p.m. PT / 7:30 p.m. ET to hear from Google engineers who will walk through solutions for the problems you tackled and answer common questions. 

Register and tune in to the event here: https://codingcompetitionsonair.withgoogle.com/events/kickstart

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.name: Professional Services Career Day
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.description:
Learn about careers in professional services and consulting firms
Connect with people in the industry including alums, and learn how you can make that transition.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.name: *Conversation with Cat Luo '19 (Pixar)
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description: Join the School of Art and the Career and Professional Development Center in conversation with Cat Luo '19. Cat currently works at Pixar as a Technical Director in Character Shade/Groom and is excited to share a bit of her story, as well as how she got into the industry in a fireside chat with Johannes DeYoung, Assistant Professor of Art.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.name: Heinz College Washington DC Colloquium - Career Exploration Panel: Cybersecurity in the Public Sector
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.description:
2020 Washington DC Colloquium 

The Washington DC Colloquium is an annual Heinz College event that aims educate students on different industries and sectors in Washington DC, while engaging them with our Heinz College alumni network.  

Thursday, November 5th 
Career Exploration Panels
In these sessions, learn about recruitment opportunities including jobs and internships, application and interview processes, and what makes a competitive applicant.  Explore various careers within these organizations, while engaging with our awesome alumni.

Seating for these panels is limited!  Reserve your seat in Handshake by Thursday, October 29th.  Please do not register if you don’t plan on attending.  It’s important to honor your reservation, since spots are limited.  

Session 1:  12 – 1 PM EST

•	Johnathan Trotman, Department for Housing and Urban Development

We’re more than ourselves.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.name: Hack the Technical Interview Workshop
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description:
Demystify the technical interview with one of our seasoned hiring managers at Visa. During this workshop, we will work through two sample technical questions in order to understand how interviewers think and the best way to approach problems during the interview process. This live info session is entirely virtual. 

Target Audience: Undergrad Freshmen and Sophomores;  We've designed our workshop to introduce historically underrepresented underclassmen students to career opportunities in the technology industry. Students who identify with a group that is historically underrepresented, including but not limited to Black, African American, Hispanic, Native American and Pacific Islanders are encouraged to register.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/606.name: Pitt x CMU Global Entrepreneurship Week: the Money Table
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/606.description:
Startup companies are a dime a dozen. Think you've got what it takes to pick a winner? Introducing The Money Table, the competition where you are the angel investor. Put real Pittsburgh startup companies in your hot seat. As you grill local entrepreneurs, real angel investors assess your investment team in a single elimination tournament. No experience required; we'll give you a crash course in investing prior to the competition. All backgrounds welcome, but you must be a graduate student to participate.

Application deadline is November 4.

Who Should Attend: Graduate Students from Pitt and CMU Only

Please apply at https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew to receive Zoom info. We will notify you of acceptance.

To see a full schedule of Global Entrepreneurship Week events, visit https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/601.name: Invest in Yourself Here Goldman Sachs Development Series: Investing in Data Storytelling
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/601.description: A GS professional from the Engineering division will be leading a session around data analytics as well as giving an introduction to a system known as Altryx.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.name: Cushman & Wakefield Global Occupier Services Info Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.description:
Have a desire to work in commercial real estate? Want to learn more about Cushman and Wakefield's Global Occupier Services job opportunities and company culture? 

Hear from a few current employees about their day-to-day functions and career path opportunities in Facilities Management, Data Analytics, and Project Management.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/606.name: Pitt x CMU Global Entrepreneurship Week: an Evening with Ben Weiss, Founder of Bai
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/606.description:
Join us for this special presentation, for GEW 2020 only! The University of Pittsburgh presents Ben Weiss, founder of Bai Brands and author of Basementality, in this new talk designed to inspire budding entrepreneurs to get their ideas off of the ground. Ben founded Bai Brands in the basement of his townhouse in 2009 and, in just seven years, built Bai into the fastest-growing brand in the industry, leading to its $1.7 billion acquisition by Dr. Pepper Snapple Group. His new book, Basementality, offers the first inside look at how he drove Bai’s fight against Big Sugar and elevated the company from his basement to a $1.7 billion brand. It is the story of old-fashioned door-to-door hustle, naïve belief and the powerful mindset of a classic American entrepreneur. Register here.
Receive a special discount code for 30% off the hardcover book on Amazon when you register for the event! (The code will expire on 11/23).

To see a full schedule of Global Entrepreneurship Week events, visit https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.name: Signify Tech internships virtual event
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.description: Join us to hear from a panel of Signify employees who work on the latest innovations in connected lighting.  Internship opportunities for 2021 include IoT Software engineering, Deep Learning, Architectural Lighting Application, Design, and more.  Panelists will share what the culture is like at Signify, how you can make an impact, plus development opportunities for interns. RSVP today!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/608.description:
Hire UP VIRTUAL CAREER FAIR Pittsburgh Technology Council   
Your #1 one place to find technology talent from across the Pittsburgh region!   

When: November 10, 2020 Time: 11am - 3pm Eastern﻿ 

 Visit https://www.pghtech.org/events/Virtual_Hire_Up for more information.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.name: Pitt x CMU Global Entrepreneurship Week: PDMA Pitch Competition
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.description:
Teams from the University of Pittsburgh, Carnegie Mellon University, and Duquesne University will pitch their innovative ideas to an expert panel of judges to compete for prizes. The winning teams will receive prizes as well as access to a variety of resources which are generously donated from local sponsoring companies. 

Register at https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew to come see the teams pitch!

To see a full schedule of Global Entrepreneurship Week events, visit https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.name: Beyond Venture For America | Alumni Stories
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.description:
Let's say that you're interested in the Fellowship Program and you want to become a startup leader or an entrepreneur one day. However, what comes after those two years and how can you benefit? 

Come attend Beyond Venture For America to see what life is after the Fellowship Program and how Fellow Alums have applied what they have learned to become successful.

VFA is also committed to the full inclusion and participation of all attendees. As part of this commitment, if reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in this event, please contact joel@ventureforamerica.org. A minimum of seven days is needed for each request. Past that, we will do our best to fulfill every request but cannot make any guarantees.

By registering for this webinar, you give us permission to contact you about our programs, events, and other marketing-related efforts. You may opt-out of this communication at any time.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/612.name: iRobot Permission to Fail Panel
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/612.description:
Employees from iRobot (maker of Roomba) will discuss the honest truth of their (somewhat bumpy) path to a career in tech and STEM. They will share tips for getting through including stress management and job hunt.  

https://irobot.zoom.com/j/95964437211?pwd=a1FGZ2FqL1JDc3duYVpneVFkRWVkZz09&from=addon
Passcode 981654

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/612.name: eBay Design Internship Info Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/612.description:
At eBay, we hire brilliant students to join as interns, so we make sure they work on relevant and meaningful projects that directly impact eBay’s business. (We don’t want you just twiddling your thumbs!) As an intern, you also actively participate in Hack Week, Intern Conference, and Intern Showcase. When you are not busy learning new things, you’ll be making new friends at the many outings, events, and adventures that will be planned to experience eBay.

Our eBay Design team invite you to join them for our Design Info Session.  At this session, you will hear about our Design Research, our Designer internship opportunities, and how we think of design at eBay. 

In order to be considered an intern, you must be enrolled in a US-accredited college or university, working towards your Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design or Design Research.  You must also have a portfolio for hiring teams to review.

If you would like to attend, please click on REGISTER below so you can upload your resume and other pertinent information.  We look forward to you joining us!

In the meantime, learn more about eBay here:  https://imagineyourcareerhere.com/View full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.name: The Virtual Job Search: How to stand out while staying in
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description:
Have you been trying to navigate the virtual job search? Are you unsure how to handle virtual interviews instead of in-person interviews? Are you questioning if you should even be looking for a job/internship?

Recruiters from Fast Enterprises will give their top tips on how to navigate through this uncertain time when searching for a job. We will cover changes to the job search process and provide tips on virtual interviews and networking. This presentation will help whether you are soon to be graduating and looking for a job or wondering what the job search will look like in the fall and want to start preparing now.

FAST is an industry leader in the development and installation of software for government agencies. We are looking for problem solvers (from a variety of majors: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, among others) to join our growing company in entry-level, full-time positions.

Fast Enterprises was recognized as a Great Place to Work® for Millennials, Technology, and Diversity in 2019! Check out our employee reviews on Glassdoor!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.name: Explore Wycliffe Live — Convergence: Emerging Roles in Translation Consulting
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.description:
Today many churches located south of the equator are taking a leading role in Bible translation. So how does Wycliffe support their efforts through translation consulting?

Come learn from Ken Schmitt about the critical role of translation consultants and how the Convergence program is uniquely positioned to support the global church’s changing needs. Convergence is a three-year program that enables people with graduate degrees or seminary training and with biblical knowledge to use their skills in Bible translation as consultants.

Explore Wycliffe Live: Convergence is a free, one-hour webinar series for you to learn about Convergence. We hope you’ll join the conversation!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.name: Two Sigma: New Seekers Summit
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.description:
Interested in learning how to apply your passion for math, science, technology, and desire to do impactful work? At Two Sigma, our community of scientists, technologists and academics collaborate to solve some of the most challenging economic problems. We rely on the scientific method, rooted in hypothesis, analysis, and experimentation, to drive data-driven decisions, to manage risk, and to expand into new areas of focus. In this way, we create systematic tools and technologies to attempt to forecast the future of global markets.

New Seekers Summit is an opportunity for students of all backgrounds to explore life at Two Sigma. During this two-day virtual program, you will have the opportunity to delve into the world of Data Scientists, Engineers, and Quantitative Researchers through networking events, talks on the role of data in finance, engineering discussions, and seminars with Engineers and Researchers at Two Sigma. Our team will also provide academic and career counselling to help you plan your own future paths, wherever they may lead you.

Dates: 
- Wednesday, November 11th - Thursday, November 12th
- 1:00 PM ET  - 5:00 PM ET both days

Requirements
- Currently attending a 4-year college/university and in your freshman or sophomore year of study OR enrolled in your first 3 years of a PhD program
- Interested in pursuing a degree in a technical or quantitative discipline, like computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics, operations research, physics, or statistics 
- No background in finance is required.

Ready to Apply?
If you would like to attend New Seekers Summit please submit a copy of your resume and a 300-500 word personal statement about your background and what you hope to learn from the Summit on our website. All applications should be submitted by November 2nd, 2020. We will notify you if your application has been accepted by November 4th, 2020.

View full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/609.name: Explore Wycliffe Live: Telling God Stories: Marketing and Communications in Bible Translation
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/609.description:
Can you imagine stories without storytellers?

Skills in marketing and communications — from graphic design and video production to social media, writing, email marketing and more — are critical to sharing the stories of what God is doing around the world through Bible translation and encouraging the church to get involved!

Join Bethany Vander Kaay, the digital strategy manager at Wycliffe USA, as she shares critical ways to use marketing and communications skills in the global Bible translation movement!

Explore Wycliffe Live is a free, one-hour online event designed for you to hear from Wycliffe missionaries serving around the world. You’ll listen to stories of God’s faithfulness, discover what daily life is like serving in different roles around the world, and ask your questions about challenging topics related to missionary life, from finances to children’s education to suffering.

Can't attend it live? Register anyway, and we'll send you the recording after the event!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.name: Pitt x CMU Global Entrepreneurship Week: Steel City Startups
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.description:
Join us for our annual event highlighting startups from throughout the greater city of Pittsburgh! Hear TEDx style presentations from Pitt and CMU innovators and learn about how they were motivated to pursue commercialization, what path they are taking, and the challenges they’ve faced. 

Speakers
Asha Banks, CEO & Founder of Cheernotes
Kunal Gandhi, CEO & Founder of SimpL
Valeria Green, CEO & Founder of CHELA Marketplace
Daniel Hack, CEO & Founder of Convertsation

Register at https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew to attend!

To see a full schedule of Global Entrepreneurship Week events, visit https://go.innovation.pitt.edu/gew.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.name: Wall Street 101 - Introduction to Equity Research
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/604.description:
Wolfe Research (currently ranked #7 by Institutional Investor) is excited to unveil our outreach program designed to give students an overview of some of the different types of jobs that are available as potential careers on “Wall Street”. As a part of our program, Wolfe Research will host a series of virtual and in-person events including meetings with highly ranked sell side and buy side analysts, company management teams, institutional sales, bankers, traders and more!

The first virtual event we are hosting is an intro to Wolfe Research and our summer internship program. See below for more details and register using our link! To apply for our Wolfe Summer Internship program, send a resume and cover letter to dor@wolferesearch.com.

What to expect?: 

Presentations and live Q&A with:
Ed Wolfe, Founder of Wolfe Research – Why is equity research an exciting career path and how is Wolfe do it different than most of Wall Street?

Jesse Bigelow, Director of Research – What does Wolfe look for in recruiting research associates, which types of skills and characteristics make a successful candidate, what are potential career paths?

Sharon Leung, Wolfe VP, Research Associate – What does an equity research associate do? What are team dynamics like?

Wolfe Summer Internship Program:
Start Date: June 1st

Wolfe Internship Opportunities Available:
Equity Research
Equity Sales
Corporate AccessView full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/609.name: Robotics Recruiting Event
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/609.description: One America Works connects high-growth technology companies with the talent they need to grow in cities across America. We are hosting a free, virtual Robotics Recruiting Event on November 13, featuring some of the fastest-growing robotics companies in the world like Locomation, industry leaders like Honeywell, and research leaders like NREC. Attendees will interview one-on-one with up to 15 different companies for both internships and full-time roles. If you are interested, please register on our website or feel free to contact paige@oneamericaworks.org with any questions.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/601.name: Invest in Yourself Here Goldman Sachs Development Series: Investing in Your Future
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/601.description: A professional from GS will lead a session around personal finance.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.name: Explore Wycliffe Live: 3 Questions to Stir Your Church's Vision for Global Mission
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/610.description:
So you want to help your church get more involved in missions. Where do you start? What questions do you ask? And why is it important to get them on board?

Join Chris Winkler as he explores practical ways you can build a strong relationship with your church and support them as they get involved in the global Bible translation movement.

Explore Wycliffe Live is a free, one-hour online event designed for you to hear from Wycliffe missionaries serving around the world. You’ll listen to stories of God’s faithfulness, discover what daily life is like serving in different roles around the world, and ask your questions about challenging topics related to missionary life, from finances to children’s education to suffering.

Can't attend it live? Register anyway, and we'll send you the recording after the event!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.name: Data Science Internship Information Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description: Are you a STEM Master's or PhD student and interested in a summer Data Science internship? If so, Capital One invites you to an interactive information session and associate panel where you'll learn about #LifeAtCapitalOne, our Data Science community, and how Data Science supports our customers everyday. You'll also hear from a recruiter about the internship experience and how to apply. We look forward to seeing you!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/614.name: Day in the Life of AmeriCorps Service
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/614.description: Join our virtual event – “A day in the life of an AmeriCorps member” – where you can learn more about Habitat AmeriCorps service opportunities, benefits to service and how to apply.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.name: Venture For America 101
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/603.description:
Venture For America is creating economic opportunity in American cities by mobilizing the next generation of entrepreneurs and equipping them with the skills and resources they need to create jobs.

Sign up to hear an overview of VFA, including how you find your job, Training Camp, and resources to launch your business or become a leader at a startup.

VFA is also committed to the full inclusion and participation of all attendees. As part of this commitment, if reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in this event, please email joel@ventureforamerica.org. A minimum of seven days is needed for each request. Past that, we will do our best to fulfill every request but cannot make any guarantees.

By registering for this webinar, you also give us permission to contact you about our programs, events, and other marketing-related efforts. You may opt-out of this communication at any time.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/613.description: Meet and speak with DIA analysts to learn about DIA's mission. Analysts will discuss their day to day activities, their backgrounds, the type of opportunities available, and tips for successfully applying to the agency!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/611.description:

APL solves complex engineering, research, and analytic problems to safeguard our nation’s security and pioneer emerging technologies. New Bachelors, Masters and PhDs in Engineering, Physics, Math and Computer Science please stop in to learn more about APL.

WE’LL TALK ABOUT
The exciting work we do at APL
Career opportunities (internships & full time)
Our two-year rotational program

Physicist, Electrical Engineers and more!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.description:

Wednesday, November 18th 5pm – 7pm EST

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.name: 2022 Insight Partners Summer & Full Time Analyst Information Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/605.description: Insight Partners is a leading global venture capital and private equity firm investing in high-growth technology and software ScaleUp companies that are driving transformative change in their industries. Founded in 1995, Insight Partners has invested in more than 400 companies worldwide and has raised through a series of funds more than $30 billion in capital commitments. Insight’s mission is to find, fund, and work successfully with visionary executives, providing them with practical, hands-on software expertise to foster long-term success. Across its people and its portfolio, Insight encourages a culture around a belief that ScaleUp companies and growth create opportunity for all. For more information on Insight and all its investments, visit insightpartners.com or follow us on Twitter @insightpartners.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.name: 9th Annual CodeVita Competition
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/607.description:
TCS’ CodeVita competition aims to introduce undergraduate students to one of the world’s biggest and best coding contests. Students from across the globe are exposed to a high-performing coding community where they can test their coding skills, get coached by mentors, earn certificates of merit and have the opportunity to join the second largest IT employer in the US. PLUS, there is a chance to win $10,000!

With access to open book research, computing resources, and flexibility of time, students complete 6 questions to answer in a 24-hour timeframe. Contest participants must be registered as part of the TCS CodeVita Program, no later than December 1st, in order to participate in the initial challenge on December 5th.

Step-by-by Instructions:

1. Register for the EVENT, by visiting this contest link: https://www.tcscodevita.com/Register
2. After logging in, you can complete the “Special Unlimited Practice Round” using this link: https://practice.tcscodevita.com/
